newsitem.title: USA: Widow of former L.A. Times publisher dies.
newsitem.headline: Widow of former L.A. Times publisher dies.

text.p: Dorothy Buffum Chandler, widow of former Los Angeles Times publisher Norman Chandler, died of natural causes Sunday at the age of 96.

Dorothy Chandler, who died in Los Angeles, retired from Times Mirror Co in 1976 as assistant to the chairman of the board and chief executive officer following a career of more than 27 years at the parent company and The Times.
She joined the company in 1948 as administrative assistant to the publisher, Norman Chandler. She was appointed director in 1955 and vice president, public service in 1961.

She served as assistant to the chairman of the board from 1969 to 1976. In 1973, she stepped down from her position on the Times Mirror board of directors and became director emeritus, a title she held until 1977.

A long-time resident of Los Angeles, Dorothy Chandler was involved with many civic, cultural, and community organizations over several decades. She raised nearly $20 million in private donations to build the city's Music Center, which was completed in 1967.
